page.title: 18Pipewell Church-St Mary's
page.content: In Pipewell there is just one church, St.Mary's. It looks quite old, but was built in 1881. The church is very small, like the village. In fact it is the smallest church in Northamptonshire. It is built in the manner of a castle and has turrets and a small moat. The church has leaded glass windows which are in an arch shape. It has a small round metal white tower with a weather cock on top. There is an old shoe scraper by the old wooden door. Its small yard has less than 12 graves, some a few 100 years old and some very recent. The church is very peaceful and is situated at one end of the village, surounded by lush woodland. The boundary means that half the village is in the parish of Rushton and half in that belonging to Desborough.
